review:
This is one of the most amazing realistic tactical large scale milsim games out there with amazing sounds, visuals, equipment, tactics, etc. Squad is a predecessor to Project Reality. There are some far fetched physics that are however completely illogical in any degree, things such as; a recycling bin stopping a tank, some tree branches toppling over a truck, the deep bodies of water in the game acting as acid and outright killing you as soon as you step into them, etc. There are some things not in the game that everyone wants but the engine cant handle well if it was to be implemented. Things such as, gore/body dismemberment, environmental destruction, attack helicopters, thermal sights for tanks, night vision combat, etc. Communication is  key in  this game, not communicating with your squad/team = dying and losing as a team. Urban warfare, vehicular battles, long range engagements, etc, be prepared for anything.

High K/D wont help the team 

Running like a crackhead like it's COD trying to run and gun wont help the team 

Playing like a one man army navy seal wont help the team  if you dont communicate with the rest of your team.

Rage quitting wont help the team 

Grabbing the tank or any other armored vehicles in hope you can outgun the whole lobby and win the game without talking wont help the team either if you dont communicate, you will just get shut down by enemy AT infantry if you dont have nearby friendly infantry to support your armor advance.

Having a mic will help the team 

Working together as one whole unit will help the team 

Following orders will help the team 

Not sprinting directly machine gunner bc you couldnt react in time to bring up ur weapon to fire back will help the team 

Working with friendly infantry units whilst playing as an armor unit when entering an urban environment will help the team 

Supporting armored assets as infantry while pushing and clearing out an urban area will help the team 

Properly managing ticket count will help the team 

You will have rage moments such as, being killed with one bullet 500+ meters from a well positioned marksman bullet and never seeing where your shooter's face and where the shots came from, after all this game is like real life combat, you wont see where your enemy is and you will fire in their general direction not knowing of you killed them or merely supressed them.

As for new players, if you have a mic and mention you're new but are willing to follow orders and communicate you will succeed, the more experienced players/squad leaders will be willing to show new players the ropes of the game.

>tldr
This game is a very realistic military simulator game that you've never seen before, communication, coordination and teamwork will almost always help win you battles, not how well you can flick headshots. Would highly recommend, 10/10 game.

It's an accessible game but far from intuitive due to complexity unless youre a seasoned arma or sim shooter fan. Which this game is simplified comparatively and far more accessible than titles like dayz or arma. 5/5
You'll find yourself experiencing situations with your squad in this game that you can ONLY experience in Squad. Try it for 110 minutes, and if it's trash you can refund it.

Brand new to PC gaming, which is probably hyping up my excitement, but I love this game. I've been a console gamer for years and craved the collaborative nature of FPS, but nothing came close to the fun I've had in a week of playing Squads. When the mortar strikes are raining down on you and you're struggling to make sense of who's who in the firefight, it is all pretty intense. I've found the community to be supportive and I'd definitely recommend this to anyone looking for true squad based action. A headset with mic is an ABSOLUTE MUST.

Can't form a squad in the main menu for game called "squad", I've had my fun with this game but after not being able to play the game with my friends time and time again that's a 0/10 for me. Game has been in dev since 2014 and a "squad join" feature still isn't implemented. That's a no from me, implement this basic ass feature and maybe me and my team will come back, till then won't be playing.
the game is legendary

The most accessible "sim" shooter there is. Emphasis on large-scale warfare, teamwork and tactics. Great support and so far, a very committed development team that produces at a consistent expectation.

I wish i could refund this game. First, it is even more un-optimized than ARMA 3. I didnt think that was possible, but this game will turn my clean PC, that is well above the minimum requirements and very close to recommended requirements into a Jet engine. It is hard to play the game knowing that this game is making my rig scream at me. I even turned graphics all the way to low, but left v-sync on (this is because doing so actually makes the game run slightly better, go figure) still turned into a jet engine within 10 minutes. Turned the resolution from HD to 1280x720 and it STILL had me worried.

But that's not all, the devs brag in their trailers about their optimizations. AS IF THAT SHOULD EVER BE A SELLING POINT. But the full 1.0 release absolutely broke the game performance and optimization. Going into any server, you will be very lucky to have 45 fps. usually get 20-30 fps. It's fps is not a slideshow like Arma normally is, but it's still bad. It's not just me, numerous people are having the same issue.

And finally, the game is not fun (in my experience). I wanted so badly to like this game. Coming from the dying ARMA 3, I was hoping this would be the Milsim to rule them all. And maybe for some it is, but I can't recommend this game. I wish so badly i could refund this game, but no milsim game can be refunded because it take 3+ hours just to figure out how to play the darn things. Save your money. Especially going forward since they will be raising the price by $10 dollars.
pretty good

BLUF - This game is a run simulator, and it is often difficult to spot enemies due to poor graphics. The price is very high for the current state of the game. But, overall I would say if you like slow paced strategy first person shooters this is for you! 

This game has a lot of potential! Things that need fixed are - graphics, choosing weapon classes, optics on weapons, and the tutorial. Everyone I've came accross in game that is new has no clue what is going on, even more experienced players are lost. The weapon class system is trash, and not realistic at all. Why cant you just make your own weapon? I understand limiting snipers, but let people customize their ARs. The graphics are the worst part of the game, it's very blurry and difficult to spot people at distance. At times this game seems like a "run simulator". More quick transport vehicles are needed, and please fix the fall damage. You can literally die from jumping off a normal compound wall (7-8ft).

Pros - the concept of the game is phenomenal, this game is funny at times and others very intense. How easy it is to kill/die makes this game great. It forces players to move tactically and move logically and as a unit. The communication structure in game is the best I've ever seen. The recoil is very realistic to each gun, and it is very well executed in this game. 

Suggestions- maybe add UAVs that patrol a small area but only 1 per game that can be placed and will last the entire match. Allow customization of weapons, many players are complaining about this.

If you are into a more tactical and slower paced shooter this is good. 
My ONLY complaint I have is that sometimes you can join a squad with a really sweaty leader, even in a noob friendly server.
I get its supposed to be Mil-Sim but it's also supposed to be a game and if you are kicking players / yelling at them for being a new player, you will just turn new players away and keep the game from expanding.

This game is infinitely more complex than Battlefield and especially COD. You need to be willing to work with your teammates and do what is expected of you. If you're willing to work in a team environment the game is incredibly rewarding. Also, it's fun as hell. Would like to see a little more weapon customization, especially when it comes to rifle scopes in future patches. Personally, I've found it difficult to see much of anything when engaging combatants from far away.

The combat is really fun and rewarding and the atmosphere is definitely more serious than Battlefield or Call of Duty. 

Unfortunately, making effective and coordinated movements at a team or at a squad level is almost impossible. You would have to join a specific community focused in tactics and realism to get the true mil-sim experience. Its very frustrating watching your team mates bash their heads aimlessly against the enemy and failing over and over again, when you know effective mortar and suppressive fire would win you the battle. The deciding factor between losing and winning is who's team is [i]worse[/i] at communicating.

Overall though, its a good time, and for somebody whose not very interested in advanced tactics or teamwork, its one of the best realistic shooters out there. I would recommend something like Arma III if you wanted a more true to life experience however.

Honestly... I thought this was going to be good.  Unfortunately, it's usually nothing more than an updated version of Unreal Tournament.  If you like to spawn/die/rinse/repeat with a kill or two in-between, good for you.  This game is 99% seeing the other guy before he sees you.  .5% is being quicker on the draw with the remaining .5 being running ballz-out-kamikazee into a stupid situation and hoping you get a kill.  

IF you're lucky enough to find a group where (BOTH SIDES) people are willing to ATTEMPT to use team-tactics and strategy, you can find a lot of fun.  Most of the time however, the Gamey McGamer goobers ruin it.  And... there are some questionable things happening as well.  Very questionable, regarding ethical game play.

It's like the low rent version of "Hell Let Loose". Although this game might have came first.

The graphics are circa 2012. Really rough, mostly square looking geometry and low quality textures. The looks and sounds of the game are subpar.

My issue though is lack of enemy identification tags.
There is name tags and or indicators for your own team but there is a second or two delay before they show up, and the further the distance the harder they are too see.
I understand this is supposed to be realistic. As realistic an army game without real bullets anyhow.
But in every other game like this at least the enemy uniforms are different.
It would help a lot if the Russian team actually had Russian style military uniforms. 
At least in Hell let Loose they had enough sense to make the German side have German uniforms.
With the lack of name tags it would be much easier and make more sense to see enemy uniforms. They are all the same USA style camo.

I personally love this game. It gives an opportunity that not many other games give, which is coordinated teamwork to defeat an opposing force, especially in large numbers. Now keep in mind that I said opportunity. I usually play on the same servers (RWR, Valhalla, and Potato Fields) and they usually have a good player base, though it can get rough at times. I personally like to SL and I like to be commander, though recently I find myself enjoying these roles less and less. It's not due to any repetitive nature or some other excuse like that, it's due to people never listening to commands. I like to be a laid back commander/SL and I like to give the squads or members freedom. Whenever I do order a command, no one tends to listen or do anything. I usually get fed up with this and decide to force them to do the order or, if I am SL, I kick them from the squad. I feel that it has gotten a lot worse recently, and I have seen it in every server. For this reason, I cannot recommend Squad. It may change over time, though at this point, I cannot recommend it.

Squad has recently hit 1.0 and I have gained roughly 500 more hours since my last review. Performance has increased exceedingly, there is so much more content and changes. There's many servers to play on and the game still takes a little time to learn. Would recommend that at least to watch a video from MoiDawg or Karmakut to learn some basics from them but the people in game usually are nice enough to help. Below is my original review from 2017 when I had somewhere around 330 hours at the time.

"Sure yeah it is hard to understand at first and nobody wants to squad lead because they're scared to or don't want to but it can be very fun to play by yourself and with friends. Other than the usual glitches, crashes, and poor performance at times, the wacky things that can happen are very fun and the sounds in the game are amazing. I would say pick this game up only if you're willing to learn how it plays because you're not going to have the best of times in the first hour to get a true feel for the game. Also just a heads up, please just pick rifleman for your first few games and if you ever choose marksman, please for the love of god just pick a different class if your Squad Leader says so because most people feel it is the most useless class. Also Desmo's Playground is a good server to ask for help as well with Level Gaming servers and be sure to introduce yourself when you join a squad and ask for help if you need it. They also have discord servers and Level Gaming has a website with a link to it. If you got this far, I wish you good luck and safe travels on the interwebs.

tl;dr
Get it only if you're willing to learn how to play, don't pick marksman, ask your teammates if you're unsure and play on Desmo's Playground or Level Gaming servers since there's usually friendly people on there."

Easily the best game I played when it comes to conventional warfare immersion.

The atmosphere is realistic and will leave you captured within it as you fight across multiple battlefields and environments. There are several factions, vehicles, weapons, and maps. Some of these are accurately modeled after real-life counterparts.

The mechanics are a combination of both realistic and simplistic approaches. However, the way everything works together along with the environment gives a powerful illusion that makes it feel like a simulation.

The game is slow-paced, and has a major focus on communication and teamwork. You're punished when playing alone, therefore you must be part of a squad in-order to be a capable fighting force. It's in the name. You must also constantly communicate with said squad using voice chat, as information is crucial to success. I would NOT recommend this game towards people with no microphones or anxiety/shyness when it comes to voice chat. It's imperative that you play prepared for that.

Learning is simple if taken step-by-step. You start from learning the classes, mechanics and being part of a squad. Enough time and you also learn to be a Squad leader. I encourage you to ask the experienced in-game. Typically they're very helpful and friendly. There is no shame in learning and making mistakes.

Version 1.0 recently released as of this review, and it includes an awesome map and also my favorite faction of all time; the Middle-Eastern Alliance. It's a good time to pick up the game now if you're interested, though note the price increase since the game left Early Access.

Highly recommended, especially for the military enthusiasts and soldiers that are looking for an excellent military experience.

Its a beautiful thing, when people work together to achieve a common goal. Especially when it involves tense firefights and explosions. More so, with strangers on the internet. The 50 people on your team can potentially make the game great, the other 50 dudes on the enemy team can potentially make it challenging. 

Get a microphone; doesn't have to be expensive, just enough that you can be heard clearly. Do your time; Live, Die, Learn, Repeat. Become the ideal Squaddie, Maybe even be a regular squad leader later on. Eventually you'll get those moments that will keep you coming back for more. 

You'll have great games and bad games, that's the way it is, its the internet and the people who play it are ever changing, coming from many walks of life and circumstances. Soon enough you'll make some in game friends and see regulars to squad up with. Take the plunge and immerse yourself. 

SQUAD is an experience and if we ever run across each other in game, let's Squad up and have a good time.

So the first of the major bugs came when I tried to adjust the mouse sensitivity. It worked, but afterwards it wouldn't allow me to look up or down at all. I managed to find a fix but it required me to clear my user data cache. Meaning I had to change all of my audio/display/keybindings again.

The second major bug I encountered was my mic was not being picked up in game (blue yeti pro), all other games it works just fine, not with squad. Unlike the previous issue I couldn't find a fix for it so I would either need a different mic or not have the ability to use voip in a game that almost requires it.

The final bug, the one that broke the camels back, was after about 5-10 minutes in-game my frames would drop to about 5-10fps and wouldn't go back to normal until after I restarted the game.

So in closing, if I change my mouse settings I wouldn't be able to move properly while not doing callouts because my mic wasn't working only to drop to 5-10fps within the first 10 minutes of battle.

The game is very poorly optimized and at the $40 price point I had no choice but to refund, which is upsetting because the game at it's core was fantastic and extremely fun. However bugs completely render the game unplayable for me.

As someone whos played all the latest shooters over the past two decades, I can easily say this is the best one yet. Battlefield level maps with Insurgency: Sandstorm level gunplay, the balance between casual and tactical shooting/team style gameplay is unparalleled in todays gaming. Having 50hrs in as of writing this review I'm still learning how to play the game to its fullest. Extremely recommend for people looking for the next best thing, or need a break from the milsim community to try something more casual. Something that keeps me coming back is their roadmap, as they are adding content all the time after release. Will be playing this with friends for months to come.
CSGO with bigger maps, tanks, and planes.  Good shit.

Don't regret buying this game at all. It's gotten better and better since Alpha and I had lots of fun so far. Emphasis on teamplay and a great atmosphere. Been getting into leading squads myself as well and it's a fun challenge to manage 8 people that solely rely on your command to have a great and successful round. Only critique I have is that the server browser is quite shit. I mean it gets the job done, but the filter options are lacking and it keeps scrolling while new servers are being added to the list, which can be quite annoying when you can't click the server you want to join. Matchmaking would be great, so I don't have to spend so much time searching for a proper server. Also quick reload would be nice, like in Tarkov, make it cost you your mag. But other than that I'm happy and can recommend the game to anyone interested in milsim with a focus on teamplay and communication.

Squad is a large-scale, team-oriented game complete with vehicles, logistics, tactics, and communications. Communicating is fundamental to this game to have a functional winning team. It's audio is robust and immersive, and will certainly give you the PTSD you are looking for in a military game. The combat provides a real sense of danger and the time to kill is extremely low. However, there are consequences to your actions such as losing some of your valuable vehicles and other resources if you do not manage your team or hold off the enemy efficiently. I can see how this game can be frustrating to people who enjoy faster-paced shooters because at first you will die a lot. But, all it takes is one intense and consistent match that will keep you coming back for more. If you are into realistic combat, and fantastic audio then this is worth picking up.

Make sure you learn how to communicate with a microphone with your Squad.
It is a very realistic military simulation game that captures the raw nature of combat teams.

only 21 hours in as of typing this but WOW what a game its got me COMPLETELY and utterly hooked, im the kind of guy that gets aggro when i take a shot to the head in most games, in this though you feel like a god and a kitten at the same time, you take someone out at a distance and your like yeah this is war and im here to win and then you take a bullet to the brain and your like ok well i have NO idea where that came from but i guess its back to the FOB for (if youre lucky, if not then back to main base) such a high intensity game and the sound design is some of the best ive ever heard it sounds like real life, the community is amazing and really leniant towards new players so if youre new and dont know something just ask and youll get all the help you need/want when you're on a good team that works well together communicates well and the squad leaders are on top of their game there really isnt anything else like this, this game is almost exactly halfway between battlefield with a tried and tested ticket based system and arma with large open maps and single shot kills to the chest, you really need to use cover, tactics, positioning and communication to stand a chance at winning a match, if youre thinking about picking up this game i would HIGHLY reccomend it
Good game, keeps on getting more fun with each update!

This game is great for teamwork oriented individuals that like to band together to reach a common goal, which is victory. If you're a CoD player, this is a total different dynamic and requires teamwork and little individual skill. If you want to get the most out of this game you should work as a team and play with experienced squad leaders to get a real sense of victory, even in defeat. This game has it's bugs and glitches here and there but for a team-based game it's one of the best in it's class.
This Battlefield 2 reskin is dope

124 Hours since my last review

I left that review on a negative note, as well as leaving a negative review to match. The game hasn't really changed much since then. Of course the game came out of EA and there was a large update, but none of that has really made me change my opinion on the game. Honestly the game still has a very long way to go. The teamwork aspect of the game (One of the main selling points) is disappearing, sure we can have new Factions and maps, but they really wont fix the state of the game. They will only attract new people to the game, which is great, but its not the correct playerbase. There are lots of newer players that don't use their mic's, which obviously is part of the game in a very major way. But for how much longer?

I have decided that I would leave a positive review today, will again return in 200~ hours. hopefully the state of the game will change again for the better.

I'm sure you've played your fair share of "realistic military FPS games", but this one is different imo. The communication aspect of the game is very unique in the sense that you MUST communicate and work together with your squad if you want to progress through the map. If you're new, find yourself a squad with a good SL (squad leader) and look for servers that are "new player friendly". Currently addicted to this game 36+hrs in. HMU to squad up!
really fun game and a great community

I played Battlefield2 : Project Reality for years, and this game is almost an exact copy with a newer engine. Yet it fails to capture the spirit of that game or the community. While in Project Reality most of the communication took place through the in-game channels, it appears that here people are extensively using Discord (or no communication at all), so the public "pick up" squads are dead. 

There is so little communication from the squad leaders, once the squad gets split up after the initial 10 minutes, it does not regroup, with everyone just running around doing their own thing. 

The squad size of 9 is too big, even as experienced PR player, it takes away from the ability to communicate and coordinate. This is unmanageable, and it does not surprise me when I see such chaos on public servers in this game.
